intro: Sesamum baumii, commonly known as the African sesame or Ethiopian sesame, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Pedaliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Sesamum baumii is often cultivated for its oil-rich seeds, which are used in both culinary and medicinal applications. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it adaptable to various arid and semi-arid environments.
